did.abstract: An 1823 broadside that advertises the auction of a farm located in Bayside, Queens to be sold by Timothy Matlack.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Bayside is a neighborhood in northeastern Queens named for its proximity to Little Neck Bay. It was first inhabited by the Matinecock people. Its first European settler was Quaker John Rodman during the American Revolution. Thomas Hicks and the Lawrence family settled in the area in the 1820s, and the community expanded after the North Shore Railroad was expanded in 1866.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An 1823 broadside that advertises the auction of a farm located in Bayside, Queens to be sold by Timothy Matlack. The farm was situated on 248 acres of land and was located on the banks of Little Neck Bay. The broadside provides detailed information on the characteristics of the property and notes its proximity to churches, schools, and resources in Flushing.
